content: I just spent 60 seconds looking for pow_pow : (a ^ b) ^ c = a ^ (b * c) for a tactic mode rewrite, before I realised that it was actually called ←pow_mul. I'm always a little worried when I see those ← signs, it feels like I'm not going in the recommended direction. Is there a case for pow_pow?
it's not a simp lemma, so you can use it whichever way you want to
I agree that both directions have some claim to reasonableness
